title: Pingla (Vidhan Sabha constituency)
text:
Pingla (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is an <a href="Vidhan%20Sabha">assembly</a> constituency in <a href="Paschim%20Medinipur%20district">Paschim Medinipur district</a> in the <a href="India">India</a>n <a href="States%20and%20territories%20of%20India">state</a> of <a href="West%20Bengal">West Bengal</a>.
Overview.
As per orders of the <a href="Delimitation%20Commission%20of%20India">Delimitation Commission</a>, No. 227 Pingla (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is composed of the following: Dhaneswarpur, Gobordhanpur, Jamna, Karkai, Kshirai, Kusumda and Pindurui <a href="gram%20panchayat">gram panchayat</a>s of <a href="Pingla%20%28community%20development%20block%29">Pingla</a> <a href="Community%20Development%20Block%20in%20India">community development block</a> and <a href="Kharagpur%20II%20%28community%20development%20block%29">Kharagpur II</a> community development block.
Pingla (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is part of No. 32 <a href="Ghatal%20%28Lok%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Ghatal (Lok Sabha constituency)</a>. It was earlier part of <a href="Panskura%20%28Lok%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Panskura (Lok Sabha constituency)</a>.
Election results.
1977-2006.
In the <a href="2006%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">2006 state assembly elections</a>, Ramapada Samanta of <a href="Democratic%20Socialist%20Party%20%28Prabodh%20Chandra%29">DSP(PC)</a> won the Pingla assembly seat defeating Hrishikesh Dinda of <a href="All%20India%20Trinamool%20Congress">Trinamool Congress</a>. Contests in most years were multi cornered but only winners and runners are being mentioned. Rampada Samanta, Independent, defeated Raj Kumar Das of Trinamool Congress in 2001. Ramapada Samanta contesting on the <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20India%20%28Marxist%29">CPI(M)</a> symbol defeated Swapan Dome of <a href="Indian%20National%20Congress">Congress</a> in 1996. Haripada Jana representing DSP(PC) defeated Saktipada Mahapatra of Congress in 1991, contesting as an independent defeated Sukumar Das of Congress in 1987 and 1982, and representing <a href="Janata%20Party">Janata Party</a> defeated Bijoy Das of Congress in 1977.
1967-1972.
Bijoy Das of Congress won in 1972 and 1971. Gouranga Samanta of <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20India">CPI</a> won in 1969 and 1967.
